# Drone News 48h Brief — November 25, 2025

_Window: last 48 hours; 59 incidents._

## Summary
In the past 48 hours, a notable surge in drone incidents has been reported across various regions. In Afghanistan, Pakistani airstrikes have killed civilians, prompting concerns about interim drone terrorism. Multiple crashes have occurred, including U.S. Air Force MQ-9 Reaper drones off South Korea and reported incidents in Romania and Moldova as Russia continues bombardments of Ukraine. On the smuggling front, Tajikistan has deployed drones to intercept illegal Afghan activities. Dutch and Belgian airports experienced disruptions due to unauthorized drone incursions, raising security concerns across Europe. Additionally, prison-related drone drops have been documented in the UK, indicating ongoing challenges in maintaining secure facilities. These patterns underscore the disparate ways drones are impacting security, law enforcement, and international relations.

**By category:** airport: 8 • arrest: 1 • crash: 23 • other: 20 • smuggling: 7
**Top queries:** drone crash (17), drone incident (16), drone smuggling (8), drone airport disruption (6), drone terrorism (4)
